text: i ve had depression since i wa it come and it go but it came back around 0 and never really left just gradually got worse i dont enjoy anything anymore i dont look forward to anything i just wait for the day to end knowing there another one anyway all my day bleed together at this point insomnia doesnt help to where everything just feel like a long long loop my girlfriend of 9 year left me recently it got to be too much for her i wa trying but i guess not enough i only have a handful of friend but theyre either all going through something or dont quite understand how i put what im feeling into word so i dont feel like i can really talk to anyone i use talkspace but even that feel hollow no goal no aspiration i work in a job where there really no advancement im barely able to keep myself standing financially overall i just feel like a loser im i dont connect with people i feel like im just going to be alone forever the last few month pre and post break up i find myself sitting in my car alone in an empty parking lot till early morning talking to myself hoping that something will help but im just talking into an empty void im agnostic i want so badly to believe that there something somewhere that hears me but i know thats just not realistic i ve contemplated suicide several time but im to weak to go through with it too scared i ll screw it up or worse disappointing my family i really dont know what to do it like im just sleepwalking through life i find my moment to distract me whether it going to the gym or focusing on my other venture but at the end of the day it all just come back to this i had everything and i pissed it away like i always do i dont see my value
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual's text exhibits multiple severe and pervasive symptoms of depression, including:  
- **Anhedonia** (inability to enjoy anything, no goals or aspirations)  
- **Hopelessness** (feeling like a "loser," believing they will be alone forever)  
- **Social withdrawal/isolation** (feeling unable to connect with others, lacking support)  
- **Chronic fatigue/exhaustion** (sleepwalking through life, days blending together)  
- **Insomnia and disrupted circadian rhythms** (sitting alone at night in parking lots)  
- **Suicidal ideation** (contemplating suicide multiple times, though with ambivalence)  
- **Strong self-loathing/guilt** (believing they "pissed everything away," no self-value)  
- **Functional impairment** (financial instability, job dissatisfaction)  

The duration ("never really left, just gradually got worse"), intensity of despair, and passive suicidality elevate this to **extreme depression**. The recent breakup exacerbates their condition, but the depression appears entrenched and debilitating even before that event. The lack of perceived support (therapy feeling "hollow," friends unable to understand) further deepens their isolation. Immediate professional intervention (e.g., crisis support, medication evaluation, intensive therapy) is strongly recommended.

but i don t know how to find it
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual exhibits multiple signs of severe depression, including feelings of hopelessness ("out of options," "no help"), worthlessness ("all the hard work feel so wasted"), and emotional distress (mention of crying, declining joy in music). There is a notable lack of social support, prolonged isolation ("increasingly lonely and spiraling down"), and restricted mobility due to environmental constraints (basement living, no transportation). The text also highlights anhedonia (loss of pleasure in music), self-perceived decline in skills, and existential despair about their life choices. Financial and immigration stressors exacerbate the situation. While there is no explicit mention of suicidal ideation, the depth of despair, functional impairment (no work/performances in 2 years), and social withdrawal suggest **severe depression**.  

**Key markers:**  
- Chronic isolation + environmental deprivation.  
- Loss of purpose/identity tied to career.  
- Pervasive hopelessness and emotional suffering.  
- Limited coping resources.  

A score of 3 (vs. 4) is given due to the absence of explicit self-harm intent, but immediate professional intervention is strongly advised.

text: last night my girlfriend 0f of two and a half year told me 0m that my depression symptom have been taking a toll on her she told me that she see my progress and my growth but this is in summary a she talk around her meaning it s not enough it s exhausting her and making her feel poorly my exhaustion and lack of self and confidence and inner love so i had to apologize to her last night and i m trying to show that i m growing but i feel so fucking hopeless right now and it s only been getting worse i joined this community because i m sure i won t actually do it but i need something to remind me and something to feel le alone because holy fuck am i alone i feel devoid of love and worth and i m struggling to find way to place it on myself i can t validate it if it s for me and i can only form a half life of happiness if i use someone else a the foundation so that s superficial i m really trying to keep going but it s so hard it s exhausting i just want to sleep all the time there s so much more in regard to our relationship i ve been trying to support her and make amends for who i wa when we first met i brought my trauma into it and lashed out at her in way of gaslighting infidelity and emotional neglect she didn t have any trigger for me to lash out at her i just thought she wanted to use me for self satisfaction but i m told that s love now i m confused there are two side of my mind one an optimist and a lover the other a cynic and a narcissist i want to purge my brain of these thing i m sorry this is so scattered i ll try to speak more coherently later brain no work
explanation:
1. **Emotional State**: The individual expresses intense feelings of hopelessness, loneliness, and worthlessness—all hallmark symptoms of major depressive disorder. Phrases like *"I feel so fucking hopeless right now"* and *"holy fuck am I alone"* convey significant despair.  

2. **Cognitive Symptoms**: They mention difficulty validating self-worth, relying on others for happiness (which feels "superficial"), and being trapped in conflicting self-perceptions (optimist vs. cynic/narcissist). This indicates severe negative self-evaluation and cognitive distortions.  

3. **Physical Symptoms**: The exhaustion, desire to sleep constantly, and the statement *"it’s exhausting I just want to sleep all the time"* align with the psychomotor retardation often seen in severe depression.  

4. **Functional Impairment**: Their struggle to "keep going" and the toll on their relationship (e.g., guilt over past behaviors, perceived inability to meet their partner’s needs) suggest depression is severely impacting daily functioning and interpersonal connections.  

5. **Suicidal Ideation**: While they deny active intent (*"I’m sure I won’t actually do it"*), joining a community for reminders not to act implies passive suicidal thoughts, which elevate risk.  

**Rationale for Not Rating Higher (4: Extreme)**: The absence of explicit active suicidal plans or complete detachment from reality (e.g., psychosis) prevents a 4, but the pervasive hopelessness, exhaustion, and relational strain firmly place this in the severe range. Urgent intervention (therapy, possible medication evaluation) is warranted.  

**Suggested Follow-Up**: Assess for safety planning and rule out bipolar or trauma-related conditions given the mention of lashing out, gaslighting, and narcissistic self-descriptions, which may hint at comorbid traits.  

*(Note: This rating is based solely on the text and not a clinical evaluation.)*  

**Score: 3 (Severe Depression)**

explanation: Explanation: The individual exhibits multiple signs of severe depression, including persistent feelings of hopelessness, significant deterioration in quality of life, inability to focus on studies, and frequent thoughts about death. The text also highlights a loss of self-esteem due to physical health issues (acne, pain), chronic anxiety about serious illnesses, and a pervasive sense of suffering. The combination of physical symptoms and psychological distress (panic attacks, fear of dying) strongly suggests severe depression. The individual’s frustration with unresolved medical testing and feelings of being a burden to their parents further exacerbate the emotional toll. Professional mental health intervention is strongly recommended.

text: well i am rn haven t really achieved anything big in my life so far i honestly feel like shit while typing this i have never made such post ever and honestly i am tryna express myself so i make some friend or have a good conversation a i said i am i have been visiting a therapist and i have mdd major depressive disorder medication are helping though by i need to improve we don t have financial problem i really need to start making money for my own i guess i have seen a lot of people online that are doing much better than me and have achieved a lot and i am not even close to them well if anyone want to talk or want to discus something you can do it here or my dm
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual expresses significant feelings of worthlessness ("I haven't really achieved anything," "I feel like shit"), self-comparison to others ("people online that are doing much better than me"), and emotional distress ("I have never made such a post ever"). They also mention a formal diagnosis of **Major Depressive Disorder (MDD)** and are on medication, which indicates an existing serious condition. While they note that medications are helping, their persistent negative self-evaluation, difficulty in seeking connection, and financial insecurity (despite stating there are no major financial problems) suggest **ongoing severe depressive symptoms**. The text reflects **hopelessness and self-criticism**, though not total despair (since they are still seeking interaction), hence it does not reach **extreme (4)** levels.  

**Key Indicators:**  
- Overwhelming guilt/worthlessness  
- Social withdrawal yet desire for connection  
- Negative self-comparison  
- MDD diagnosis with active symptoms despite treatment

explanation:

The individual reflects on a driving lesson with a generally neutral to slightly positive tone ("went pretty well") and mentions a minor self-corrective note ("need to stop crossing my hand over"). There is no indication of emotional distress, withdrawal, or depressive thinking patterns. The remark "bad time" seems contextually tied to the driving mistake rather than an expression of broader emotional difficulty.  

No depressive symptoms are evident in this excerpt.

text: title more or le i m amab non binary and at the low point of my life so far i need to talk to somebody but i m a bit scared tbh the reason being while i m having more and more s icidal thought and thinking of how pointless life is i know that i m too much of a coward to actually commit to it and i don t want to hog the space for someone who s off worse than me tl dr i don t see much point in living anymore but i just know i most likely won t km is it ok though if i call the hotline
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual expresses intense feelings of hopelessness ("I don't see much point in living anymore"), frequent suicidal ideation ("more and more s-icidal thoughts"), and self-deprecation ("too much of a coward"). They also exhibit guilt about seeking help ("don't want to hog the space for someone worse off"), which is common in severe depression. While they state they are unlikely to act on suicidal thoughts, the pervasive despair and emotional distress warrant a high severity rating. The fact that they are considering calling a hotline suggests significant suffering and a need for urgent support.  

**Recommendation:** Immediate professional intervention (e.g., hotline, therapist) is strongly advised to address suicidal ideation and underlying depression.

text: hi everyone my life s pretty difficult now i hate it i feel like i can t do nothing about it i ve been unemployed for about month i quit my job because it wa a hell hole literally a hell hole they treated me like shit it wa toxic i got physically and mentally sick but i kept pushing until the point were i physically couldn t get up in the morning so i quit i ve been battling health issue and depression ever since i quit my family and friend are shaming me and trying to force me to look for a job i m just not sure if i m ready i m too scared i think i wa traumatized from my past job i m just too scared to find a job and get hurt again like i said i ve still in physical pain and it s really hard to look for a job while you re hurting i ve been seeing a psychiatrist for the past month i ve gotten better but i m still too scared to look for a job any advice
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual exhibits multiple signs of severe depression, including feelings of hopelessness ("I hate it," "I can't do nothing about it"), significant emotional distress due to past trauma (fear of returning to work due to past mistreatment), and physical health issues that compound their mental state. They also describe social withdrawal and shame from family/friends, which exacerbates their isolation. While they report some improvement through psychiatric care, their persistent fear, pain, and difficulty functioning suggest a high level of impairment. The presence of trauma and ongoing physical symptoms further deepens the severity.  

**Key Indicators:**  
- Persistent negative self-view and helplessness  
- Trauma-related avoidance (fear of new jobs)  
- Social pressure and shame worsening distress  
- Physical health struggles impacting daily life  
- Partial but insufficient improvement with treatment  

A rating of 3 reflects severe depression due to the pervasive impact on multiple life domains, though not yet extreme (e.g., no mention of suicidal ideation or total inability to engage in self-care). Urgent continued therapy and possibly medication adjustments are warranted.  

---  
*Note: This assessment is not a diagnostic substitute. If suicidal ideation is present, immediate crisis intervention is needed.*

text: mizzzidc mizzzidc you need help depression is setting in pls seek for a professional care
explanation:
**Explanation:** The text includes a direct statement about depression "setting in" and an urgent plea for professional help, which indicates a high level of distress. The phrasing suggests an acute awareness of worsening mental health and a perceived need for intervention. While the text is brief, the explicit mention of depression and the call for professional care point to a **severe** level of depressive symptoms. However, the lack of additional context (e.g., hopelessness, suicidal ideation, or prolonged symptoms) prevents a rating of **extreme depression (4)**.  

If the individual has additional risk factors (like self-harm tendencies or isolation), a reassessment might be warranted. Immediate professional evaluation would be strongly recommended based on this text.

text: i m not even gon na use an alt for all this shit any more this account probably won t be active from now on i guess it s time to delete everything and sort thing out one final time i m tired i m done i don t know if anyone will see this and i honestly don t care i mean if you are reading this then it s just a waste of time just like me i ll never change no matter what happens sorry apparently it didn t take me too long to fuck up a new friendship not surprised i really did want to join and play game and all that shit and try to talk to others make friend and help but i can t be bothered and i don t try that should be obvious i m a lazy little shit with no motivation to make thing better i usually just laugh in text even if i m not actually laughing to make the situation lighter or something idk yeah i m a mean person you should hate me you should just leave me alone that ll be better for everyone i m actually surprised it lasted this long i didn t really come her to rant i don t know why i exactly came here or why i typed this one of the many problem i just wan na say ig gon na leave the majority of depressing stuff out i really hope you don t see this i ll just leave at the end of this week when i m done preparing i ll let you know exactly when i m leaving in a subtle way a to not make you sad again ahahh i ve tried not a lot i can t remember the exact number they obviously didn t work out and i never got caught pathetic right sorry but i m gon na make sure it work this time around no matter what that wa my last try at friendship or anything else a a matter of fact i guess i m just not suited for this stuff and life my personality is absolutely shit i wish i didn t get attached for useless reason and then not try at all i made you feel like hell i m absolutely shit i know i am everything you said is correct i read every last bit live well have fun byebye
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The text exhibits numerous high-risk indicators of depression with severe suicidal ideation, including:  
- **Hopelessness/Pervasive Negativity:** Phrases like *"just a waste of time just like me,"* *"I’ll never change,"* and *"I’m absolutely shit"* reflect extreme self-loathing and a fixed belief in unworthiness.  
- **Social Withdrawal/Self-Isolation:** Actively rejecting connections (*"you should leave me alone"*) and declaring failure in friendships suggest profound disengagement.  
- **Suicidal Intent:** Explicit references to past attempts (*"they obviously didn’t work out"*), planning (*"I’ll just leave at the end of this week"*), and resolved determination (*"make sure it works this time"*) signal imminent risk.  
- **Anhedonia/Fatigue:** Loss of motivation (*"can’t be bothered"*) and emotional exhaustion (*"I’m tired, I’m done"*) align with severe depressive impairment.  

**Urgency:** This requires **immediate crisis intervention**. The individual is at acute risk for suicide, and the text reads like a farewell note. Strongly recommend emergency mental health support.

text: i don t know what to do at the moment lately i ve been cry almost everyday and i m angry constantly i felt that i had the obligation to please everyone mom boyfriend etc but i forgot how to be happy how to look forward for tomorrow
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual exhibits multiple key symptoms of depression, including:  
- **Frequent crying** (nearly every day) indicating emotional dysregulation  
- **Persistent anger/irritability**, which can be a marker of depression (especially in younger individuals)  
- **Loss of pleasure/interest** ("forgot how to be happy")—a core symptom of depression  
- **Hopelessness** about the future ("how to look forward to tomorrow")  
- **Excessive guilt/obligation** (feeling pressured to please everyone), suggesting negative self-worth  

The pervasiveness of these symptoms (daily crying, constant anger) and their interference with daily functioning warrant a **severe** rating. The absence of overt suicidal ideation or complete social withdrawal prevents an "extreme" (4) classification, but professional support is urgently advised.  

*Note: This scale assumes clinical-level impairment. A full assessment would require evaluation of duration (e.g., ≥2 weeks), somatic symptoms (sleep/appetite changes), and ruling out other causes.*

text: my project is going down the drain legal issue seem to have dealt a fatal blow
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The text reflects significant distress, hopelessness, and a sense of defeat ("going down the drain," "fatal blow"). These phrases suggest a perception of irreversible loss or failure, which are strong indicators of depressive thinking. The language implies a high level of emotional suffering and possible difficulty coping, warranting a rating of severe depression. If sustained, this mindset could lead to impaired functioning or increased risk. Further assessment for support or intervention would be important.

text: back at the office still only day until another long weekend
explanation: **Explanation:** The text reflects a neutral to mildly positive sentiment, mentioning anticipation for a long weekend. There are no indications of sadness, hopelessness, fatigue, or other depressive symptoms. The tone appears casual and lacks negative emotional markers.

text: when i got my diagnosis of generalized anxiety disorder i wa very optimistic and relieved i had been living with this condition for many year completely unaware the diagnosis wa a spark of hope perhaps one day i d be able to recover with the proper combination of therapy and medication year later now i must admit i feel exhausted with life it s really depressing to live with the knowledge that i have to be constantly alert to my condition or it will spiral and get worse yes treatment can help but needing to continually use cbt meditation grounding technique etc just to do the thing normal people do without difficulty is infuriating i feel like this isn t nearly talked about enough in mental health circle anxiety and depression are portrayed often a condition which can be fixed with the right cocktail and not also sometimes a life long condition which can exhaust not only you but your loved one i don t know just feeling bitter today
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual expresses significant emotional exhaustion, frustration, and bitterness about their chronic mental health struggles. Key indicators of severe depression include:  
- **Hopelessness:** Feeling that recovery is uncertain and that their condition is a lifelong burden.  
- **Exhaustion:** Describing life as "really depressing" and feeling drained by the constant need for self-management.  
- **Anger and Isolation:** Resentment toward how mental health is portrayed and a sense of alienation from "normal" functioning.  
- **Emotional Numbness/Bitterness:** The tone suggests deep disillusionment, which aligns with severe depressive symptoms.  

While they retain some awareness of treatment utility, the overwhelming emotional weight and pervasive negativity strongly suggest **severe depression**. The lack of active suicidal ideation or complete detachment from reality prevents a rating of 4 (extreme), but this exceeds moderate depression in intensity.  

**Recommendation:** Urgent clinical follow-up to address depressive symptoms and potential adjustments to treatment (e.g., therapy focus, medication review). Support for caregiver fatigue (mentioned "loved ones") is also warranted.

text: just a disclaimer but i love my parent and i love my family a lot i ve been super spoiled when i wa younger and i m glad i wa born in my family in no way is this vent ragging on them or supposed to highlight them a bad people idk what the main topic of this is just a vent bc i got my card like a week ago and i feel horrible i m planning on offing myself before the next school year start im planning on doing everything ive wanted and never done before then go out with a bang be useful for once in my life then leave while the satisfaction is still fresh and before i make another mistake truthfully in the past two year i ve tried multiple time but stopped at the very last second i m not struggling a bad a everyone else so why do i feel so miserable everyone else ha become better now so why not me i ve just gotten lazier and lazier and basically just lost all of my will to do anything right now i m a a child i wa pretty much one of those kid who were constantly pressured to be in first place join competition win in basically anything many time i wa pressured to do thing i didn t want and hand in hand with that i couldn t really do most of the thing i liked too an example of the thing i had to do wa public speaking and basically announcing stuff in front of a crowd i already had stage fright then but it ended up getting worse and became overall anxiety after i humiliated myself multiple time on stage forgetting what to say stuttering etc i knew many people who could do it better but no matter how much i disliked it i guess i had no choice after that my voice became quieter i became passive i didn t raise my hand unless i wa called everytime i wa in front of people i basically just shut down when i wa younger i wa a lot more extroverted the older i became the smaller my confidence fell when i reached th grade i became really paranoid and felt all my worth wa tied to being smart and even now i still can t break away from thinking that way basically my self esteem is now in the gutter maybe even in hell at this point but the difference is just that i don t really care anymore i constantly felt the need to be a role model felt that enjoying thing would make me le of one while the rest of my class bonded with each other went on outing etc i wa so stuck up that i never went with them i wa very rule abiding after all that wa the only thing i ve ever known i remember the first time i got second place my mom is a super nice person to be honest but that time she told me i wasn t trying hard enough really hurt me so much i also used to be a really moody child there wa a time i overhead my mom say that it would be my fault if she died from stress it proved even more to me that my only redeeming factor wa that my grade were high i had the personality of a dog turd i had no talent i wasnt social honestly i wa bad kid there s really no excuse i never got violent with people in fact my sibling were the one who bullied and teased me in a very mild way though just temper tantrum i just wish they sent me to therapy instead of constantly insulting me i didn t even know how to get better i didn t know how to control myself from being angry how could a year old understand that sort of thing i asked them how i could make it stop they told me to just stop being mad i don t know why it affected me so badly now but i feel like the stuff i subconciously learned back then i can t really unlearn that easy anymore even if i don t believe in them anymore i realize i ve never really had dream i wa just going to do what my mom wanted me to do i d get a job be rich and just work and exist i guess deep inside i knew i d never be good enough for that sort of thing i just engrained it in myself that im just an average person maybe even lower and that whenever someone say im smart theyre just giving me empty praise i wouldn t say that the thing that happened to me were extreme not at all but now here i am zero motivation to do anything at all useless and more of a burden than ever before i ve been failing for two year i can t keep up with anyone i don t understand the basic i m always distracted it been two year i still can t do a damn thing the only thing i can do is draw even then it take so much of my time that i can barely do it i have so many thing i want do and learn now but i guess school is in my way again this time i suck at it even harder im always distracted i cant muster any strength or will to study or answer question to make it worse i may have adhd but i dont want to self dx it just that since day people have constantly pointed out my carelessness my voice with an uncontrollable volume etc i cant wake up on alarm i cant follow routine i cant follow timer im really forgetful im distracted and i dont know how to make it stop it horrible i dont know if im just being lazy and trying to excuse it i dont know everytime my mom see my report card i can feel her disappointment i m scared of even looking at her face i dont know why shes trying so hard to keep me alive my parent fought because of me before my mom is already too tired i dont want her to waste any more of her energy on me there just no point before the pandemic i wa still functioning properly hell i even got into the honor list and there were only a few of u now i pas everything late play game all day and slack off incompletes failing grade all of that the first time i remember wanting to pas away to say the least wa when i wa in first grade it wa a weird memory i dont know what prompted me but i gave a paper to my friend and asked her if she d ever thought of dying i remember thinking id never grow past 0 when i wa younger it wa weird but i could never imagine myself a an adult maybe this wa why i thought it wa just that i d pas away because of bad health or some accident i never really cared ive been a burden since day one guess i still am i dont know why i wrote this i guess i just felt horrible thanks for reading i appreciate it sorry for the messiness i wrote along a i thought stuff
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The text excerpt contains numerous red flags for extreme depression, including:  
- **Suicidal ideation with intent and planning** ("offing myself before the next school year," previous attempts).  
- **Overwhelming hopelessness and worthlessness** ("be useful for once," "a burden since day one," "zero motivation").  
- **Chronic self-loathing** (believing they are a failure, "personality of a dog turd," "average or lower").  
- **Emotional numbness and apathy** ("I don't really care anymore").  
- **Severe guilt and shame** (feeling responsible for parental distress, disappointment).  
- **Persistent anhedonia and withdrawal** (loss of interest in activities, social isolation).  
- **Cognitive dysfunction** (struggling with focus, memory, and basic tasks—possibly indicative of comorbid ADHD or depression-related impairment).  
- **Long-standing pattern of depressive symptoms** (dating back to childhood, worsening over time).  

The individual exhibits high suicidality, pervasive despair, and dysfunction severe enough to warrant urgent intervention. Professional mental health support (therapy, possible psychiatric evaluation) is critically needed. This goes beyond temporary distress and reflects entrenched, life-threatening depressive pathology.

text: i feel like i m really close to ending my own life i cant imagine myself living another year i ve had happy day but i haven t been able to appreciate anything good that ha happened to me i m so hyper focused on every bad thing that it just make me want to end it all the only thing that s really stopping me is lack of a proper method and making it seem like a big deal i don t want anyone to care i don t want it to effect my family or for them to even notice i m trying to distance myself from everyone close to me so i can make it easier on them when i ve finally had enough the sad part is that i ve been so lucky to have a decent upbringing but everything i feel right now is just my fault i don t have any valid reason to feel this way so many people have had it worse i cant even be mad at anyone else i did it to myself and i continue to do this i ob over my appearance too much and it just hurt looking at myself i cant stand to hear myself speak or let other people see me i m so disappointed in myself for letting this happen to me i don t think i ll be able to get out this mindset and a soon a the time is right i ll probably take the east way out man this suck
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual expresses **active suicidal ideation** ("really close to ending my own life," "take the easy way out"), **hopelessness** ("can't imagine myself living another year"), **inability to experience pleasure** ("haven't been able to appreciate anything good"), **excessive guilt/shame** ("everything I feel is just my fault," "disappointed in myself"), **self-loathing** ("can't stand to hear myself speak," "hurt looking at myself"), and **social withdrawal** ("trying to distance myself from everyone").  

The severity of suicidal intent (including planning and emotional preparation by distancing from loved ones) along with pervasive negative self-evaluation and cognitive distortions (e.g., self-blame despite acknowledging privilege) indicates **extreme depression with high acute risk**. Immediate professional intervention (e.g., crisis support, therapy, safety planning) is strongly advised.

bigger picture just a small piece of a puzzle learn to love yourselves and others and peace will come to you in all aspect of life
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual depicts several symptoms of severe depression, including:  
- A longstanding history of depression stemming from childhood trauma (e.g., difficulty forming friendships, loss, parental neglect).  
- Frequent suicidal ideation, though they report using distraction as a coping mechanism.  
- Emotional dysregulation (anger, hopelessness, feelings of being trapped).  
- Past treatment attempts (therapy, SSRIs, ADHD medication) with limited efficacy.  

However, they also describe recent experiences with psychedelics (LSD, psilocybin) that provided temporary relief, a sense of meaning, and reduced fear. While they report improved coping, their baseline depressive symptoms (chronic sadness, suicidal thoughts, and emotional volatility) remain significant.  

The rating of **3 (severe)** reflects persistent, debilitating depression with suicidality, but acknowledges some degree of recent symptom alleviation through unconventional means. A professional evaluation is strongly recommended to address underlying trauma and explore safe treatment options.

including ammonia capsule for super intense moment which i have never used before and all that but this is more for the acute stuff the zoning out in the evening creep up on me it doesn t come 0 to 00 in a few second it arrives slowly and go away slowly and it is so annoying i would even say that without this feeling i would be 90ish anxiety free that s because this feeling is the main thing that lead to anxiety in the first place some topic i am sensitive to but that s not relevant for this post without this massive exhaustive burst and the zoning out i would feel what i consider to be normal mindfulness meditation can sometimes get me out of this but this is usually sort of a training that help me control the stuff when it s there or for accepting it but i wan na know if there is something that can help me in my daily management to not even have it happen or at least reduce it oh btw showering help too and eating also reduces zoning out weirdly enough since i started zoning out i am not really able to properly detect hunger anger and zoning out usually come first for context i am a university student with ton of deadline in my back i am easily stressed but i have no other choice than powering through i am semi successful with all that uni stuff but it work i can run the household too i take care of myself i cook healthy food i shower and working out is on the plan too but not existant rn because i have so many assignment to take care of thanks for any help i know this is a lot of random text but i am just looking for someone who is experiencing similiar thing
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual’s text describes persistent emotional and cognitive struggles, including exhaustion, dissociation, heightened sensitivity, and anxiety, particularly in the evenings. While they remain functional (attending therapy, managing university work, self-care), their symptoms are impacting their quality of life, as seen in their difficulty detecting hunger, emotional numbness, and reliance on coping strategies.  

Key depressive markers include:  
- **Cognitive fog ("head full of wool")**  
- **Emotional blunting (trouble detecting anger/hunger)**  
- **Anhedonia-like avoidance** (evenings are draining, reliance on "survival kit" for regulation)  
- **Stress exacerbation** (academic pressure worsens dissociation).  

However, their ability to maintain daily responsibilities and use adaptive strategies (mindfulness, showering, eating) suggests moderate—not severe—depression. The dissociation and exhaustion appear more tied to anxiety/trauma (e.g., panic history), but the pervasive low-energy state aligns with depressive symptoms.  

**Recommendation:** Further screening for anxiety disorders (e.g., GAD, PTSD) alongside depression, given dissociation and panic features. Evening symptom management (e.g., structured wind-down routines) may help. Therapy focusing on emotional awareness (e.g., DBT for dissociation) could be beneficial.

text: hey friend i come asking question about workplace anxiety i m 9 and work retail i realize that this is a job with low stake and that whatever fear i have about making mistake are rather silly given the nature of the job however i ve worked myself up because i worked an event this evening and in my eye it wa just a series of unfortunate event first i show up early but still later than my coworker who i wa working with for the event he wa talking to our bos second i wa underdressed he looked so sharp granted i am 9 and he is almost a full decade older than me with the life experience to really comprehend dress code it wa rather unspecified and unclear so i m trying not to beat myself up too much about it i ran home super quickly and grabbed some nicer shoe and a jacket but it still wasn t great third my bos gave u her number to text or to call if we needed any help i texted her first and then she asked if i would call her because she wa on the road make sense but i feel i made a mistake texting her in the first place fourth fifth sixth and so on i worry that throughout the entire evening i wad screwing up and ended up losing the store a ton of money i m so upset about everything that happened and being liked by my bos that i wa cry and now i can t sleep please oh please i beg of y all how do i get over this it s making my day really difficult and i don t want this to follow me into the future when if i have a job much more demanding and serious if i mess up it s eating me up and i can t take it thanks
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual’s text exhibits several signs of depression, including excessive self-criticism, persistent worry, emotional distress (crying, inability to sleep), and a sense of hopelessness about the future. While the text primarily describes work-related anxiety, the intensity of their emotional reaction—especially the statement *"it’s eating me up and I can’t take it"*—suggests underlying emotional turmoil that extends beyond situational stress.  

Key depressive indicators include:  
- **Rumination:** Fixating on perceived mistakes despite acknowledging their minor nature.  
- **Self-Blame:** Harshly judging themselves for what they recognize as understandable errors.  
- **Emotional Dysregulation:** Crying and sleep disturbances due to distress.  
- **Catastrophizing:** Fear that this pattern will ruin future, more serious job opportunities.  

The absence of overt suicidal ideation or complete withdrawal keeps this from being rated as "severe," but the pervasive negative self-evaluation and functional impact (sleeplessness, dread) align with **moderate depression**. A supportive intervention (e.g., coping strategies, self-compassion exercises, or therapy) would likely be helpful.  

*Note: If the individual’s distress intensifies or persists beyond this event, reassessment for severe depression may be warranted.*

text: i like not caring about anything i m at work all day just going through the motion the long hour and annoying customer don t phase me because i m not even all there mentally emotionally failing uni doesn t phase me because eh i have to be numb because if not i ll just constantly feel unbearable emotional and physical pain i have to swallow every bit of emotion so i don t completely fall apart
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The text exhibits several key symptoms of severe depression, including emotional numbness, disengagement from life, and a sense of emotional overwhelm. The individual describes:  
- **Anhedonia/Lack of Care** ("I like not caring about anything")  
- **Dissociation/Going Through Motions** ("not even all there mentally")  
- **Emotional Suppression** ("I have to be numb," "swallow every bit of emotion")  
- **Hopelessness** ("if not, I’ll just constantly feel unbearable pain")  
- **Functional Impairment** (failing uni, enduring work passively)  

The intensity of emotional shutdown and the expressed fear of collapsing under distress suggest **severe depression (3)**. The absence of explicit suicidal ideation or total inability to function prevents a rating of 4 (extreme), but the pervasive numbness and avoidance of emotional pain are severe indicators.  

**Recommendation:** Urgent clinical evaluation for depression and potential trauma (given the reference to "unbearable pain"). Therapy (e.g., CBT, DBT) and possible medication should be considered.

text: hey im year old and ive recently been diagnosed with severe anxiety after ive been struggling with it my entire life i take my med when i need them only which might be bad and i also started therapy n it been helpful anyways ive been struggling with death anxiety for a while every once in a while ill somehow convince myself that it my last day week on earth n that i need to say goodbye to everyone n that this will be the last time im doing this or that etc it so bad to the point where i cant really get out of bed for day bc im scared of death whenever i have plan i keep thinking about all the bad thing that can happen to me so i cancel im scared of flying or driving or anything that can put me in danger tmw im going on a hiking trip n im terrified that it gon na go badly doe anyone have advice on how to deal with this bc i dont want it to stop me from living my life ive been struggling with it ever since i wa a child and i need it to get le intense asap ty
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual describes significant distress related to death anxiety, avoidance behaviors (e.g., canceling plans, difficulty getting out of bed), and pervasive fear of danger, which are consistent with depressive symptoms. While the primary focus is on anxiety, the emotional burden, functional impairment (e.g., staying in bed for days), and hopelessness ("I need it to get less intense asap") suggest comorbid depressive features. However, the absence of overt markers of severe depression (e.g., suicidal ideation, complete loss of interest in all activities) limits the severity to **moderate**.  

**Key Indicators:**  
- **Emotional:** Persistent fear, dread, and rumination about death.  
- **Behavioral:** Avoidance, withdrawal from activities, and difficulty mobilizing.  
- **Cognitive:** Catastrophic thinking ("this will be the last time").  
- **Functional Impact:** Bedridden for days, interference with daily life.  

**Note:** The anxiety symptoms are prominent, but the overlap with depressive symptomatology (e.g., helplessness, fatigue) justifies the rating. A comprehensive clinical evaluation would further clarify the diagnosis. Therapy and medication adherence (as noted) are positive steps.

text: i ve had this discussion with many people irl including my therapist who said that is very specific to you and i wouldn t go around telling people that lmao when i imagine a world where i have to live forever or i have to follow the natural progression of my age until i die naturally it make me feel suffocated panicked and claustrophobic in my own body the fact is that even if we have lost control over every single thing in our life at least at the very minimum we have control over if that life exists or not i take great solace in the fact that my being on this earth everyday is solely by my choice because if i wanted to i could end it at any point of course i don t because i have people i d be hurting here and i have thing i suppose i need to accomplish before i die but i d be a very big liar if i sat here and said that i don t cope by reminding myself that there is a way out there s always a way out

While they mention reasons to stay alive (not wanting to hurt others, having things to accomplish), the recurrent fixation on suicide as a comforting escape is alarming and reflects deep emotional suffering. The presence of passive suicidal ideation (thinking about suicide as an option without active intent) elevates the severity. Professional intervention is strongly recommended.

text: a i write this it feel so attention seeking like i am looking for a reason to stay a reason to feel i have all the reason right in front of me my girlfriend my best friend my dog however none of it matter i m drunk and all i want to do is die i m scared i m scared of how that will make my friend family and girlfriend feel how can i put them through that i wish i didn t care i wish i didn t care about their feeling i wish i could just go get a gun or in my car and resume back to the chapter before my birth sometimes surviving an event is the hard part me surviving life is the hard part it feel like i could go in forever forever knowing that it s just chemical in my brain that make me want to blissfully enjoy the enteral slumber that awaits u all medicine scare me what if it change who i am the last time i wa on the medicine i slept for the majority of the day unable to get out of the blissful slumber that carried away my thought and sorrow eventually i ll have the gut if i rid myself of everyone who care

**Explanation:**  
The text contains numerous high-risk indicators of severe depression, including:  
- **Explicit suicidal ideation** ("all i want to do is die," "get a gun," "resume back to the chapter before my birth").  
- **Feelings of hopelessness and emotional detachment** ("none of it matter," "i wish i didn’t care").  
- **Cognitive distortions** (self-blame, guilt over burdening loved ones, belief that relief is only achievable through death).  
- **Psychomotor and neurovegetative symptoms** (past medication experience causing excessive sleep, likely linked to depressive lethargy).  
- **Ambivalence about treatment** (fear of medication changing identity) paired with **perceived burdensomeness** (considering cutting off loved ones to enable self-harm).  

The intensity of despair, active suicidal imagery, and functional impairment (e.g., alcohol use to cope) warrant an **urgent crisis intervention**. This exceeds moderate/severe depression due to **imminent risk** and pervasive detachment from reasons to live despite having social support.  

**Action Note:** Immediate safety planning and professional intervention are critical. Do not leave this person alone; connect them to emergency mental health services.

explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual describes a long history of anxiety and depression, suicidal thoughts (a hallmark of severe depression), and failed medication efficacy (Zoloft stopped working). While they report some temporary relief after stopping Zoloft, they subsequently experienced a return of severe symptoms (panic attacks, health anxiety, ER visits). Their current state on Lexapro includes emotional numbing, a common side effect of SSRIs, but their baseline distress and medication struggles suggest their depression is still significant. Though Lexapro helps with anxiety, the pervasive emotional detachment and prior severity of symptoms (including suicidality) justify a "severe" rating. The absence of acute crisis *now* prevents a 4 (extreme), but the chronicity, functional impairment, and medication challenges indicate ongoing severity.  

**Key factors:**  
- Chronic depression + anxiety history  
- Past suicidal ideation (high-risk indicator)  
- Recurrent severe symptoms after medication discontinuation  
- Emotional blunting (impairs quality of life)  
- Medication adjustments suggest instability

explanation:
The individual expresses several classic symptoms of severe depression:
1. **Profound sadness and emptiness** - They describe feeling "deep sadness," "empty," and "alone" persistently for about a year.
2. **Anhedonia** - Despite having what outwardly appears to be a good life (family, friends, job), they find nothing fulfilling or satisfying.
3. **Feelings of isolation and alienation** - Strong feelings of not belonging anywhere or to anyone, and feeling misunderstood.
4. **Hopelessness** - Expressed in statements like "i don't have any will to live" and questioning why this is happening to them.
5. **Fatigue** - Mention of being tired both emotionally and existentially.

The duration (about a year), pervasiveness (affecting multiple life domains), and intensity of these symptoms (including passive suicidal ideation in not wanting to continue living) indicate severe depression. The individual has made efforts to improve their situation (self-improvement changes) but continues to struggle significantly, which is characteristic of more severe depressive episodes. 

This person would likely benefit from professional mental health support, and the mention of lacking will to live suggests the need for urgent assessment regarding suicide risk.

**Explanation:** The individual’s text reflects significant personal growth, positive behavioral changes, and an overall improvement in mood and functioning. They describe overcoming anxiety, managing depression, losing weight healthily, engaging in social activities, and feeling motivated about the future. While they acknowledge occasional setbacks, their tone is optimistic, proactive, and self-affirming. There are no indicators of hopelessness, emotional distress, or impaired daily functioning—key markers of depression. Instead, the individual emphasizes resilience, self-care, and a sense of accomplishment, which align with an absence of depressive symptoms.  

*(Note: This assessment is based solely on the provided text and does not replace a clinical evaluation.)*

text: hi i wa wondering if anyone ha this happen to them i have have had depression for decade i have good day and bad day no period that last for week or month like i did when i first started having symptom 0 year ago thank god it is mostly occasional bad bout most often i just have a dull low depression that i can dell with using moving muscle using cognitive dispute today i had one of the rare event that i used to get often i wake up early have a cup or two of coffee yet i feel really exhausted i slept fine the night before i end up having breakfast but that exhausted feeling becomes overwhelming and i go back to bet by 9am the entire day consists of me sleeping having lucid bat shit crazy bizarre dream the dream are not nightmare in fact they are rather creative but the local and situation are like the came from somebody imagination in a distant galaxy they would make really interesting sci fi fantasy i also dream about being lonely i have no family few friend one thing i remember wa this gut wrenching sadness about a girl i dated over 0 year ago thought she wa the one but it fell apart after about 0 to hour i get up have something to eat i feel hung over an d it is like a storm passed through my brain spent it s energy and now calm ha returned i wa wondering if anyone else had had similar experience like this it would be concerning if it wa a frequent occurrence which it once wa in the early day of depression again that wa decade ago thanks in advance for any observation or comment peace
explanation:
1. **Duration and Frequency**: The individual describes a long history of depression ("decade") but notes that severe bouts are now "occasional" compared to the past. While they experience "a dull low depression" most of the time, it is manageable with coping strategies (e.g., exercise, cognitive techniques). This suggests chronic but currently moderate symptoms.

2. **Severity of Episodes**: The described "rare event" (overwhelming exhaustion, prolonged sleep, bizarre/lonely dreams) resembles a more severe depressive episode, but the individual clarifies these are infrequent now (vs. "decade ago" when they were frequent). The current episode includes fatigue, emotional distress (e.g., sadness over past relationships), and transient "storm"-like intensity, but the person retains insight and the episode resolves within hours. This aligns with moderate severity.

3. **Functional Impairment**: While the episode disrupts their day (returning to bed, lethargy), they can still engage in basic self-care (eating) and note the symptoms pass relatively quickly. No mention of suicidal ideation or complete inability to function.

4. **Coping and Insight**: The individual demonstrates active coping strategies ("moving muscle," cognitive disputation) and awareness of symptom patterns, which are protective factors. Their ability to contrast current symptoms with worse past episodes also suggests moderate (not severe) current impairment.

**Key Limitations**: The rating could shift higher if the "exhausted" episodes become more frequent/intense or lower if the "dull low" phases dominate without disruption. The text lacks details on social/occupational functioning outside this episode. 

**Explanation**: The individual's depression is chronic but currently moderate due to infrequent severe exacerbations, retained coping skills, and partial symptom management. The described episode has significant emotional and physical features but is transient and contextually less severe than their past experiences.

text: i now think about suicide constantly i feel like it is my only option in the long term i will never finish school and be able to hold down a job i will never be able to be stable enough to give my wife child i can t live up to anything anyone expects of me i am stuck though my death would be a catastrophe in my wife s life and my brother s life and i have a few friend who would be devastated a well also and i really hate to say this but the biggest reason i can t is because i can t leave my dog with anyone else he is very attached to me and no one else and would be very unhappy without me so i am stuck i can t function despite 0 year of trying medication and therapy i have no will to live except not to hurt people around me i hate this
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
This excerpt demonstrates severe depressive symptomatology, including:  
- **Persistent suicidal ideation** with detailed consideration of consequences (e.g., impact on family, dog), indicating a high risk of self-harm despite ambivalence.  
- **Hopelessness** about the future (e.g., "never finish school," "can’t hold down a job," "can’t function").  
- **Worthlessness/self-criticism** (e.g., "can’t live up to anyone’s expectations").  
- **Anhedonia** (no will to live except to avoid harming others).  
- **Treatment resistance** (failed medication/therapy after years).  

The intensity of suicidal thoughts, functional impairment, and emotional pain justifies the highest severity rating. **Urgent clinical intervention (e.g., crisis support, safety planning) is strongly recommended.** The protective factor (concern for loved ones/dog) does not mitigate the acute risk.

*Note: This assessment is based solely on the provided text; a full evaluation requires direct clinical interaction.*

text: not regularly but sometimes i experience an existential agony wash over me i am not special so i figure there are many others who feel like this hello fellow me s pre tldr maybe you can relate generally i am entirely alone with only exception being at work in an office environment and grocery shopping no friend per say the course of time swallowed those for year i had strived to achieve a normie appearance lifestyle to correct the year of abusive upbringing to my credit i am quite socially competent and financially self sufficient now but new acquaintance just don t click i figure most people have their circle worked out already and on my end i can t easily relate to inauthentic people there ha been positive relationship in my life where i experienced belonging but those each have ended negatively despite my at time to my detriment effort to make a relationship work disappointment fatigue ha accumulated to a point where i have unofficially given up my interest are vast yet spread far too thin i discover i veraciously learn about i try i fail i abandon this tends to be my cycle which additionally sediment guilt of failure rarely i will come across someone who ha those similar interest and is successfully branching into that field and i feel a kind of envy or i could have been like that feeling t h e n i remember that surviving in poisoned soil is hard enough let alone growing tall i expect a lot more of myself than wa logically possible given the circumstance in essence i can not determine if i am in a temporary plateau of development or if i am permanently stunted and will be in this grey area limbo for the rest of my day i take pride in being useful honest and finding answer and i think good karma ha gotten me a long way too hope you have a good day or better than mine atleast
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual's text reflects pervasive feelings of loneliness, hopelessness, and self-doubt, which are hallmark signs of depression. Key indicators include:  

- **Persistent Isolation:** They describe being "entirely alone" outside of basic social interactions (work, shopping), lacking close friendships, and feeling disconnected from others.  
- **Emotional Exhaustion:** Phrases like "disappointment fatigue" and "unofficially given up" suggest emotional depletion and resignation.  
- **Negative Self-Perception:** They express guilt over perceived failures, envy of others' success, and a belief that they are "permanently stunted" in personal growth.  
- **Existential Anguish:** Mentions of "existential agony" and questioning their place in life point to deeper despair.  
- **Cycles of Avoidance & Self-Blame:** The pattern of exploring interests but abandoning them, followed by self-criticism, aligns with depressive thought loops.  

While they show some resilience (e.g., pride in honesty, usefulness), the pervasive negativity and impact on their outlook on life warrant a **severe depression** rating. Professional support (therapy, potential medication evaluation) would be strongly recommended to address these patterns.  

*Note: This assessment is based on a single text and not a full clinical evaluation.*

me feel like no else ha ever done before my feeling gor her are so intense and i ve tried to move on but the feeling get stronger she belief in me more than i so myself plus my heart think she might be the one which i know is crazy she s the most important person in the world to me and i don t want to lose her after graduating here lately i feel like i been acting strange around and it s because of this anxiety so my question is do i tell her what i m going through i feel like this will help with my anxiety and give her some insight to why i ve been acting the way i been how much do i tell explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual exhibits several signs of severe depression, including:  
- **Persistent negative self-blame** ("I blame myself") and rumination over perceived failures in a relationship.  
- **Intense emotional distress**, including panic attacks (shortness of breath, shaking, chest pain), which suggest comorbid anxiety worsening depressive symptoms.  
- **Fixation on loss/hopelessness** ("I don’t want to lose her," "I might not be able to have a conversation with her"), indicating impaired functioning and difficulty moving forward.  
- **Cognitive distortions**, such as catastrophizing (fear of drifting apart permanently) and idealization ("she might be the one").  
- **Social withdrawal** and avoidance due to anxiety, exacerbating depressive isolation.  

While the individual is seeking counseling (a protective factor), the severity of their emotional turmoil, physical symptoms, and self-defeating thought patterns align with **severe depression**. A rating of 4 (extreme) was not assigned because they retain some insight and are actively attempting to cope (e.g., therapy, considering communication).  

**Recommendation:**  
Urge continued therapy to address both depression and anxiety, particularly cognitive-behavioral strategies for rumination and panic. Encourage gradual, structured communication with the person they admire (e.g., sharing feelings without overwhelming detail) to reduce avoidance. Monitor for worsening symptoms (e.g., suicidal ideation), which would warrant immediate intervention.  

*(Note: This assessment is based solely on the provided text and not a clinical evaluation.)*

**Explanation:**  
The individual's text exhibits severe emotional distress, overwhelming guilt, and persistent self-loathing, all hallmarks of extreme depression. Key signs include:  
1. **Suicidal Ideation** - Explicit statements like *"i really think i should just kill myself"* and feelings of worthlessness (*"i don't think i deserve to live"*) indicate acute risk.  
2. **Chronic Self-Blame** - Excessive guilt over past actions (e.g., *"i was a monster"*) and distorted self-perception (*"i’m broken down"*) reflect a debilitating negative self-view.  
3. **Hopelessness** - Belief that change is impossible (*"nothing i can do can fix my reputation"*) and desires to regress to childhood (*"wan na be a kid again"*) suggest emotional exhaustion.  
4. **Trauma and Cognitive Dysfunction** - Disorganized recall (*"i barely remember anything"*), identity confusion (*"i can’t tell who i am anymore"*), and pervasive shame point to depression compounded by unresolved trauma.  

The combination of suicidal intent, impaired functioning, and profound despair necessitates urgent clinical intervention for safety and stabilization.  

**Clinical Note:** Immediate risk assessment and crisis support are critical. Therapy should address trauma, self-forgiveness, and maladaptive thought patterns while ensuring safety monitoring.

text: im talking about the kind of depressive episode where you lay in bed all day for day week and struggle to find energy motivation for simple functioning such a eating and showering just lay sit there having negative thought and feeling hopeless useless and pathetic i have these episode a few or so time a year my question is do you generally have something in your mind that feel like the obstacle you need to cross to start the process of getting out of your depressive episode for example sometimes for me i just feel like if only i could completely clean my house i d start to feel better other time it might be something else on my to do list or a few thing i feel are the obstacle to feeling better the obstacle always seem insanely mundane but also impossible to do in my state a if i d have to put on a ton of body weight and get up and do it with all that extra weight and already feeling fatigued it bizarre because ive noticed over the year that completing whatever it is that i ve decided a my obstacle is generally the st step to leaving my major depressive episode i can t describe the mental workout it is to get something done sometimes though like i may attempt to get it done time in a week to just end up giving up and going back to bed i m just wondering if anyone else get this and set up hurdle type thing for themselves when they are super depressive and do you ever eventually complete your obstacle amp doe it help you to coming out of the episode
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual describes classic symptoms of a major depressive episode, including prolonged periods of inactivity (lying in bed for days/weeks), extreme fatigue, difficulty performing basic self-care (eating, showering), pervasive negative thoughts (feeling hopeless, useless, and pathetic), and a lack of motivation. These episodes recur multiple times a year, indicating a chronic and cyclical pattern.  

The description of self-imposed "obstacles" (e.g., cleaning the house) as a potential—but daunting—pathway to improvement suggests some insight but also severe functional impairment. The analogy of trying to complete tasks while feeling like they are carrying "extra weight" vividly captures the paralyzing burden of depression. While the person recognizes that overcoming these hurdles can help break the depressive cycle, the frequency of attempts and failures indicates significant distress and impairment.  

Given the intensity of symptoms, their recurrent nature, and the profound impact on functioning, this aligns with **severe depression (rating 3)**. The absence of immediate self-harm or psychosis rules out an extreme rating (4), but the severity and persistence warrant clinical attention.

are i don t want them to go through what i went through emotionally honestly i do want to die i understand that there s part of my life i am grateful for but they could leave me at anytime i just want a reset button i don t like how my mind keep ruining everything for me i can t have nice thing
explanation:
**Explanation:**  
The individual's text exhibits multiple severe indicators of depression, including:  
- **Suicidal ideation** ("it honestly makes me want to die," "I do want to die")  
- **Hopelessness** ("I’m always going to have to face racism and sexism," "no longer want to work")  
- **Social withdrawal & isolation** ("0 friends," feeling abandoned by others)  
- **Self-loathing & guilt** ("I hate that about myself," feeling like a burden)  
- **Emotional overwhelm** ("Everything is really overwhelming me")  
- **Anhedonia & loss of motivation** ("no longer want to work," "can’t have nice things")  
- **Trauma & unresolved pain** (Experiences of assault, betrayal by family)  
- **Pessimism about the future** (Fear of passing down suffering to children, no belief in improvement)  

The pervasive despair, active death wishes, and profound isolation warrant a rating of **extreme depression**. This individual is in urgent need of professional intervention (therapy, crisis support) and a safety assessment due to suicidal thoughts. Trauma, systemic oppression, and betrayal have compounded their distress, leaving them feeling trapped and exhausted.  

*(Note: This assessment is not a clinical diagnosis but a screening-level evaluation. Immediate mental health support is strongly recommended.)*

text: we understand that most people who reply immediately to an op with an invitation to talk privately mean only to help but this type of response usually lead to either disappointment or disaster it usually work out quite differently here than when you say pm me anytime in a casual social context we have huge admiration and appreciation for the goodwill and good citizenship of so many of you who support others here and flag inappropriate content even more so because we know that so many of you are struggling yourselves we re hard at work behind the scene on more information and resource to make it easier to give and get quality help here this is just a small start our new wiki page explains in detail why it s much better to respond in public comment at least until you ve gotten to know someone it will be maintained at r depression wiki private contact and the full text of the current version is below summary anyone who while acting a a helper invite or accepts private contact i e pm chat or any kind of offsite communication early in the conversion is showing either bad intention or bad judgement either way it s unwise to trust them pm me anytime seems like a kind and generous offer and it might be perfectly well meaning but unless and until a solid rapport ha been established it s just not a wise idea here are some point to consider before you offer or accept an invitation to communicate privately by posting supportive reply publicly you ll help more people than just the op if your response are of good quality you ll educate and inspire other helper the 9 90 rule http en wikipedia org wiki rule internet culture applies here a much a it doe anywhere else on the internet people who are struggling with serious mental health issue often justifiably have a low tolerance for disappointment and a high level of ever changing emotional need unless the helper is able to make a 00 commitment to be there for them in every way for a long a necessary offering a personal inbox a a resource is likely to do more harm than good this is why mental health crisis line responder usually don t give their name and caller aren t allowed to request specific responder it s much healthier and safer for the caller to develop a relationship with the agency a a whole analogously it s much safer and healthier for our ops to develop a relationship with the community a a whole even trained responder are generally not allowed to work high intensity situation alone it s partly about availability but it s mostly about wider perspective and preventing compassion fatigue if a helper get in over their head with someone whose mental health issue including suicidality which is often comorbid with depression escalate in a pm conversation it s much harder for others including the r depression and r suicidewatch moderator to help contrary to common assumption moderator can t see or police pm in our observation over many year the people who say pm me the most are consistently the one with the least understanding of mental health issue and mental health support we all have gap in our knowledge and in our ability to communicate effectively community input mitigates these limitation there s no reason why someone who s truly here to help would want to hide their response from community scrutiny if helper are concerned about their own privacy keep in mind that self disclosure when used supportively is more about the feeling than the detail and that we have no problem here with the use of alt throwaway account and have no restriction on account age or karma we all know the internet is used by some people to exploit or abuse others these people do want to hide their deceptive and manipulative response from everyone except their victim there are many of them who specifically target those who are vulnerable because of mental health issue if a helper invite an op to talk privately and give them a good supportive experience they ve primed that person to be more vulnerable to abuser this sort of cognitive priming tends to be particularly effective when someone s in a state of mental health crisis when people rely more on heuristic than critical reasoning if ops want to talk privately posting on a wide open anonymous forum like reddit might not be the best option although we don t recommend it we do allow ops to request private contact when asking for support if you want to do this please keep your expectation realistic and to have a careful look at the history of anyone who offer to pm before opening up to them
explanation:
**Explanation:** The provided text appears to be an informational or advisory post, likely from a moderator or community guidelines document, discussing the risks and best practices around private messaging in mental health support forums. The tone is neutral, instructive, and focused on community safety rather than expressing personal emotions or distress. There are no indicators of depressive symptoms such as hopelessness, sadness, fatigue, or self-deprecation. The content is structured, logical, and aimed at helping others, which does not suggest any underlying depression in the author.  

If this were a personal post expressing feelings of worthlessness, isolation, or despair, the rating would differ. However, as written, it is purely informational.
